sections.methods: Narrative, non-systematic review and commentary on reimbursement, billing, coding, and financing models relevant to interventional pulmonology in the United States and Canada.
sections.results: Key descriptive findings: fee-for-service predominates; alternative models discussed include RVU-based payment, pay-for-performance, medical home, and ACOs. Medicare payment examples and RVU components are described. Example 2013 Medicare conversion factor stated as 34.023. Tables provide example CPT codes and work/nonfacility/facility RVUs for common interventional pulmonology procedures.

population.text: Not a clinical study; no patient population. Policy and reimbursement overview for interventional pulmonology practice in the US and Canada.

retrieval.summary_tldr: Narrative review describing reimbursement, coding, and payment models for interventional pulmonology, outlining implications of RVUs, pay-for-performance, medical homes, and ACOs in the US and Canada.
retrieval.clinical_relevance: Provides practical context for building and sustaining interventional pulmonology services within evolving reimbursement frameworks; no patient outcomes reported.
